text: John Thomas Dooling (February 22, 1871 - November 15, 1949) was the assistant district attorney for New York City and an adviser to Tammany Hall for 40 years. ==Biography== Dooling was born on February 22, 1871 in Brooklyn, New York City. He died on November 15, 1949 in White Plains, New York. ==References== Category:1871 births Category:1949 deaths Category:Lawyers from New York City Category:People from Brooklyn
title: John Thomas Dooling
